books.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus

chapters.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:1
verses.text: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:2
verses.text: And when Tiberius Caesar, the emperor of the Romans, was labouring under a grievous disease, and understanding that there was at Jerusalem a certain physician, Jesus by name, who by a single word cured all infirmities, he, not knowing that the Jews and Pilate had put Him to death, ordered a certain friend of his named Volusianus:  Go as quickly as possible across the seas; and thou shalt tell Pilate, my servant and friend, to send me this physician, that he may restore me to my former health.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:3
verses.text: And this Volusianus, having heard the emperor's command, immediately departed, and came to Pilate, as he had been commanded.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:4
verses.text: And he related to the same Pilate what had been entrusted to him by Tiberius Caesar, saying:  Tiberius Caesar, the emperor of the Romans, thy master, having heard that in this city there is a physician who by his word alone heals infirmities, begs thee earnestly to send him to him for the curing of his infirmity.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:5
verses.text: Pilate, hearing this, was very much afraid, knowing that through envy he had caused Him to be put to death.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:6
verses.text: Pilate answered the same messenger thus, saying:  This man was a malefactor, and a man who drew to himself all the people; so a council of the wise men of the city was held, and I caused him to be crucified.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:7
verses.text: And this messenger returning to his inn, met a certain woman named Veronica, who had been a friend of Jesus; and he said:  O woman, a certain physician who was in this city, who cured the sick by a word alone, why have the Jews put him to death?  And she began to weep, saying:  Ah me! my lord, my God and my Lord, whom Pilate for envy delivered, condemned, and ordered to be crucified.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:8
verses.text: Then he, being exceedingly grieved, said:  I am vehemently grieved that I am unable to accomplish that for which my lord had sent me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:9
verses.text: And Veronica said to him:  When my Lord was going about preaching, and I, much against my will, was deprived of His presence, I wished His picture to be painted for me, in order that, while I was deprived of His presence, the figure of His picture might at least afford me consolation.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:10
verses.text: And when I was carrying the canvas to the painter to be painted, my Lord met me, and asked whither I was going.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:11
verses.text: And when I had disclosed to Him the cause of my journey, He asked of me the cloth, and gave it back to me impressed with the image of His venerable face.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:12
verses.text: Therefore, if thy lord will devoutly gaze upon His face, he shall obtain forthwith the benefit of health.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:13
verses.text: And he said to her:  Is a picture of such a sort procurable by gold or silver?  She said to him:  No; but by the pious influence of devotion.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:14
verses.text: I shall therefore set out with thee, and shall carry the picture to be seen by Caesar, and shall come back again.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:15
verses.text: Volusianus therefore came with Veronica to Rome, and said to Tiberius the emperor:  Jesus, whom thou hast been longing for, Pilate and the Jews have delivered to an unjust death, and have through envy affixed to the gibbet of the cross.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:16
verses.text: There has therefore come with me a certain matron, bringing a picture of Jesus himself; and if thou wilt devoutly look upon it, thou shalt immediately obtain the benefit of thy health.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:17
verses.text: Caesar therefore ordered the way to be strewn with silk cloths, and the picture to be presented to him; and as soon as he had looked upon it, he regained his former health.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:18
verses.text: Pontius Pilate, therefore, by the command of Caesar, is taken and brought through to Rome.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:19
verses.text: Caesar, hearing that Pilate had arrived at Rome, was filled with exceeding fury against him, and caused him to be brought to him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:20
verses.text: But Pilate brought down with him the seamless tunic of Jesus; and he wore it on him in presence of the emperor.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:21
verses.text: And as soon as the emperor saw him, he laid aside all his anger, and forthwith rose up to meet him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:22
verses.text: Nor was he able to speak harshly to him in anything; and he who seemed so terrible and fierce in his absence, now in his presence is somehow found to be mild.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:23
verses.text: And when he had sent him away, immediately he blazed out against him terribly, crying out that he was a wretch, inasmuch as he had not at all shown him the fury of his heart.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:24
verses.text: And immediately he made him be called back, swearing and declaring that he was the son of death, and that it was infamous that he should live upon the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:25
verses.text: And as soon as he saw him, he forthwith saluted him, and threw away all the ferocity of his mind.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:26
verses.text: All wondered; and he himself wondered that he should thus blaze out against Pilate when he was absent, and that while he was present he could say nothing to him roughly.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:27
verses.text: Then, by a divine impulse, or perhaps by the advice of some Christian, he caused him to be stripped of that tunic, and immediately resumed against him his former ferocity of mind.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:28
verses.text: And when at this the emperor wondered very much, it was told him that that tunic had belonged to the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:29
verses.text: Then the emperor ordered him to be kept in prison, until he should deliberate in a council of the wise men what ought to be done with him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:30
verses.text: And a few days after, sentence was therefore passed upon Pilate, that he should be condemned to the most disgraceful death.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:31
verses.text: Pilate, hearing this, killed himself with his own knife, and by such a death ended his life.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:32
verses.text: When Caesar knew of the death of Pilate, he said:  Truly he has died by a most disgraceful death, whom his own hand has not spared.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:33
verses.text: He is therefore bound to a great mass, and sunk into the river Tiber.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:34
verses.text: But malignant and filthy spirits in his malignant and filthy body, all rejoicing together, kept moving themselves in the waters, and in a terrible manner brought lightnings and tempests, thunders and hail-storms, in the air, so that all men were kept in horrible fear.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:35
verses.text: Wherefore the Romans, drawing him out of the river Tiber, in derision carried him down to Vienna, and sunk him in the river Rhone.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:36
verses.text: For Vienna is called, as it were, Via Gehennae, the way of Gehenna, because it was then a place of cursing.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:37
verses.text: But there evil spirits were present, working the same things in the same place.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:38
verses.text: Those men therefore, not enduring such a visitation of demons, removed from themselves that vessel of malediction, and sent him to be buried in the territory of Losania.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Death of Pilate, Who Condemned Jesus 1:39
verses.text: And they, seeing that they were troubled by the aforesaid visitations, removed him from themselves, and sunk him in a certain pit surrounded by mountains, where to this day, according to the account of some, certain diabolical machinations are said to bubble up.
